Module org.example._50zo
Package Model.Players

Class AdapterPlayers

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
Model.Players.AdapterPlayers
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, IPlayers
Direct Known Subclasses:
PlayerGPU, PlayerHuman
public abstract class AdapterPlayers extends Thread implements IPlayers
The AdapterPlayers class serves as an abstract base for different types of players participating in the card game. It implements the IPlayers interface and extends Thread to allow concurrent execution of player actions. Each player has its own hand of cards, a turn order, and access to shared game elements such as the deck, card pile, and turn manager.
Since:
2025

  • Constructor Details

    • AdapterPlayers

      public AdapterPlayers(Deck deck, int myTurn, Object lock, TurnManager turnManager, CardPile cardPile)
      Constructs a new player adapter with the specified game components and configuration.
      Parameters:
      deck - the main deck used for drawing cards
      myTurn - the turn number assigned to the player
      lock - the synchronization object used for turn control
      turnManager - the manager that controls turn order
      cardPile - the pile of cards currently in play

    • AdapterPlayers

      public AdapterPlayers(Deck deck)
      Constructs a new player adapter initialized with a deck only. This version automatically sets the player as active.
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck from which the player will draw cards

      Parameters:

    • putCard

      public void putCard(int indexCard, CardPile cardPile) throws InvalidCardException
      Attempts to play a card from the player's hand at the given index. If the card would cause the pile's total value to exceed 50, an InvalidCardException is thrown.
      Specified by:
      putCard in interface IPlayers
      Parameters:
      indexCard - the index of the card in the player's hand
      cardPile - the card pile where the card will be placed
      Throws:
      InvalidCardException - if playing the card exceeds the value limit
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided index is invalid

    • takeHand

      public void takeHand()
      Clears the player's hand and draws 4 new cards from the deck. If the deck is empty, fewer than 4 cards may be drawn.
      Specified by:
      takeHand in interface IPlayers

    • getHand

      public List<Card> getHand()

      Returns:

    • getIsPlaying

      public boolean getIsPlaying()
      Returns whether the player is still active in the game.
      Returns:
      true if the player is active; false otherwise

    • hasValidCards

      public boolean hasValidCards()
      Checks if the player has any playable cards that can be placed on the pile without exceeding a total value of 50. If no valid cards exist, the player is marked as eliminated.
      Returns:
      true if the player has valid cards to play; false otherwise

    • getIsplaying

      public boolean getIsplaying()
      Returns the player's current active state (duplicate accessor).
      Returns:
      true if the player is still playing; false otherwise

    • getTurn

      public int getTurn()
      Returns the player's turn number.
      Returns:
      the player's turn identifier

    • initializePlayer

      public void initializePlayer()
      Initializes the player by activating them and dealing an initial hand. Prints a confirmation message to the console.
